wiki.content: "Call Me Maybe" is a song by Canadian Juno-nominated artist former Canadian Idol contestant singer-songwriter Carly Rae Jepsen. It was released in September, 2011 but it only met success by the second quarter of 2012. The song peaked at #1 in British, Australian, Canadian and Irish US charts. The Call Me Maybe Songfacts says it was the first Billboard Hot 100 #1 by a Canadian artist in over five years. The previous citizen of Canada to record a chart-topper was Avril Lavigne who reigned with "Girlfriend" in May 2007. Carly Rae Jepsen was destined for success ever since fellow Canadian Justin Bieber began tweeting about a song he had heard on the radio whilst home from Christmas called “Call Me Maybe”. Carly says the song is about “that spark you feel when you lock eyes with someone you like for the first time”, the song debuted at No.1 on the UK singles chart earlier this year. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: "Call Me Maybe" is a song by Canadian Juno-nominated artist former Canadian Idol contestant singer-songwriter Carly Rae Jepsen. It was released in September, 2011 but it only met success by the second quarter of 2012. The song peaked at #1 in British, Australian, Canadian and Irish US charts. The Call Me Maybe Songfacts says it was the first Billboard Hot 100 #1 by a Canadian artist in over five years. The previous citizen of Canada to record a chart-topper was Avril Lavigne who reigned with "Girlfriend" in May 2007.

comments: So call me maybeee! Love this song!!

15 months later, this amazing song, is #1 on my Top Singles Chart! Love u gurl!

Carly has been a great artist since her ascent into the music industry. Her beautiful voice and meaningful lyrics have provided shock and awe to her fans. While her full-length debute, is fairly new, I'm most certainly looking forward to her following release. "Kiss", The Deluxe Edition, has been in my library for quite some time now. Listening to "Kiss"' on a daily basis never gets old. [3]
50 years old and still love this tune! Young love really does suck! Don't get me wrong! I am just thinking back when I had young love. Then we do grow up
Me and my friends love rocking out to this at dances keep it up Carly!!!!!!!
